snippet: An analysis found that delaying clamping for at least a minute after birth significantly improves iron stores and hemoglobin levels in newborn babies.
abstract: Analysis published in The Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews finds that delaying clamping of umbilical cord for at least a minute after birth significantly improves iron stores and hemoglobin levels in newborns and does not increase the risks to mothers.
lead_paragraph: An analysis found that delaying clamping for at least a minute after birth significantly improves iron stores and hemoglobin levels in newborn babies.

headline.main: Study Finds Benefits in Delaying Severing of Umbilical Cord
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Benefits In Delaying Severing Of the Umbilical Cord
